image.altText: Ted Egan smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Folk music legend, author and former Northern Territory administrator Ted Egan has died aged 93.

title.children: Former NT administrator, musician and author Ted Egan dies aged 93

image.altText: A profile image of Md Isfaqur Rahman wearing a white shirt, tie and jacket.

props.synopsis: A Tiwi Islands man who murdered 23-year-old Bangladeshi student Md Isfaqur Rahman during a Darwin home invasion in 2023 has been sentenced to life behind bars.

title.children: International student's killer sentenced to life behind bars

image.altText: A man being escorted through an airport by two police officers.

props.synopsis: Peter Scammell, who is facing a murder charge over the death of his partner Katrina Hawker five years ago, was granted bail just over 24 hours after being extradited from Victoria.

title.children: Man accused of partner's murder granted bail one day after extradition

image.altText: Man in front of a microphone gesticulating in a radio studio mid sentence  wearing a black t-shirt.

props.synopsis: A community radio station in Alice Springs is becoming a breeding ground for new, diverse voices by giving people with disability a platform to broadcast.

title.children: People with disability 'blossom like a flower' on community radio

image.altText: A colourful sign that says "Laramba COmmunity" in front of a dusty, grassy landscape.

props.synopsis: A remote rent policy that saw some Northern Territory residents slugged with hikes of up to $300 a fortnight has been struck down on appeal by the High Court.

title.children: Controversial remote NT rent hikes struck down by High Court

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman with grey hair and a younger Aboriginal girl sit at a desk and look at a painting.

props.synopsis: An apprenticeship program in a remote Northern Territory town is helping businesses find skilled workers by connecting homegrown teens to local employment.

title.children: 'Proudest grandmother' works alongside granddaughter at Barkly art centre

image.altText: An artist's impression of a large hotel next to a body of water.

props.synopsis: A $100 million luxury hotel planned for the Darwin Waterfront has fallen through, after concerns were raised by Larrakia traditional owners over its interference with a sacred site.

title.children: High-rise hotel planned for Darwin Waterfront scrapped after controversy

image.altText: A building with "Palmerston Police Station" written on the awning.

props.synopsis: Days after acting Northern Territory Ombudsman Bronwyn Haack raised the alarm about "inhumane" conditions in overcrowded police cells, the government says just six inmates remain.

title.children: Six prisoners left in NT police cells after ombudsman's report

image.altText: Two people in front of a large modular home, which is sitting on the back of a truck, waving in celebration.

props.synopsis: A one-of-a-kind home, designed with the input of Tennant Creek families, has rolled up the Stuart Highway from Adelaide on a convoy of trucks. It is part of a new initiative aiming to transform housing in remote First Nations communities.

title.children: Home designed by Tennant Creek residents to live 'our way' arrives on truck

image.altText: Two conjoined PNG twins wearing yellow beanies lie in a small hospital crib.

props.synopsis: A rare set of conjoined twins are being urgently airlifted from Papua New Guinea to Australia, with doctors recommending they be separated as soon as possible.

title.children: Conjoined twins airlifted to Australia as case reaches 'critical' point

image.altText: A home alight on a sandy bank as fire burns.

props.synopsis: A shack has burnt down in a bushfire in Dolphin Sands on Tasmania's east coast, where residents were told to find shelter.

title.children: 'Had to watch it burn': Home destroyed as bushfires flare in Tasmania

image.altText: hand pulling condom out of pocket.

props.synopsis: China is ending a decades-long tax exemption on contraceptives to push up its birth rate. Experts say the change could leave women and young people more vulnerable.

title.children: Why condoms in China are about to get more expensive

image.altText: A middle-aged man with wire glasses and a business-like haircut reads the news in front of an older-looking blue background.

props.synopsis: A sports aficionado whose baritone voice earned him the nickname "Big Daddy", Higgins read the news on Channel Nine, the ABC and a slew of radio stations over the course of his 57 years in the media.

title.children: Arthur Higgins, broadcaster who covered Moon landing and 9/11, dies aged 85

image.altText: A close up of Penny Wong.

props.synopsis: The Coalition seizes on meeting notes from June to claim the government is working to return Australian children and partners of Islamic State fighters.

title.children: Wong will not say if further Islamic State family members on track to return

image.altText: A drone shot of an island

props.synopsis: Little St James is commonly referred to "Epstein Island" and according to attorneys for his accusers, the island was the site of many crimes committed against underage girls.

title.children: Locals called it 'Paedophile Island' but for Epstein it was 'perfect'

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann exits a court building, wearing a casual outfit,

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann has changed his plea to guilty and been sentenced for one count of using a vehicle without the consent of the owner.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann sentenced for using car without consent

image.altText: A politician smiles while tickling a newborn baby in hospital

props.synopsis: With Australia's fertility rate at a new low and concerns about its economic impact on the future, the former treasurer behind the early 2000s baby boom says all options should be on the table to encourage more children.

title.children: Baby bonus father Costello wants falling fertility 'back on the agenda'

image.altText: A man smiles in a photo with coworkers

props.synopsis: Detectives have issued an additional 83 charges against Joshua Dale Brown, a former childcare worker who was charged with more than 70 offences earlier this year.

title.children: Alleged childcare paedophile Joshua Brown hit with further charges

image.altText: Aerial photo of traffic at a standstill on a motorway, with trees either side

props.synopsis: Drivers have been stuck in Sydney's M4 tunnel for several hours over fears part of its concrete roofing could tumble onto traffic.

title.children: Fears tunnel roof could crumble onto cars halts Sydney traffic for hours

image.altText: Medicine blister packs on a red surface.

props.synopsis: Health experts say tighter regulations around pregnancy supplements are needed as newer brands replace folic acid — a key nutrient shown to prevent birth defects — with a lesser-studied alternative.

title.children: What's in pregnancy supplements? Sorting science from marketing spin

image.altText: A young child holds a mobile phone with a padlock graphic embossed over the top.

props.synopsis: Today marks the unofficial start of the teen social media ban. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: The teen social media ban is here. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: A man wearing dark sunglasses and a black jacket

props.synopsis: The South African Neo-Nazi who sparked controversy during a protest outside NSW parliament has left Australia after his visa was revoked.

title.children: Neo-Nazi and family leave country after minister revoked visa

image.altText: A woman in black-rimmed glasses against a blue backdrop

props.synopsis: Parents at a South Australian school say they have been left in the dark about photos taken by a principal during a school camp.

title.children: Children interviewed about ex-principal's school camp photos

image.altText: Cartoon of Anthony Albanese sitting alone in the Speaker's chair in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: The annual showcase of the year's top political cartoons has opened at Old Parliament House in Canberra, depicting the biggest national and global events with satire and wit.

title.children: 'A lot to poke fun at': The best political cartoons of 2025

image.altText: A digitally blended composite image comprised of people and the RBA

props.synopsis: A leading economist says the "risk" of an "imminent" RBA interest rate hike is "rising", while former treasurer Peter Costello is urging Australia to arrest its fertility downturn.

title.children: Economist flags risk of several RBA rate hikes in 2026 — as it happened

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley sits with her dogs.

props.synopsis: The judge presiding over the trial of Rajwinder Singh, accused of the 2018 murder of Toyah Cordingley, is summing up the case before the jury goes out to deliberate.

title.children: Jury in trial of man accused of Toyah Cordingley's murder told motive not key

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at press conference

props.synopsis: Despite holding a commanding position, Anthony Albanese knows the global trend of sliding trust in government isn't one to be taken lightly.

title.children: Three things show Albanese's score on trust and integrity

image.altText: A crowd of people gathered with some waving banners and flags while Big Ben looms behind them in the background

props.synopsis: Two of the UK's leading groups for women and girls will stop offering membership to trans women in the aftermath of a Supreme Court ruling.

title.children: Leading groups for UK women and girls to close doors for trans women

image.altText: Puppy

props.synopsis: A rescue helicopter has winched five people and a blue heeler puppy to safety after their boat filled with water off the north Queensland coast.

title.children: Five people and a puppy saved from ocean after boat sinks

image.altText: AWU Queensland boss Stacey Schinnerl breaks down

props.synopsis: A rival union leader has broken down in tears at a Queensland inquiry while recounting how a CFMEU member publicly berated and harassed her in front of her 13-year-old son.

title.children: Rival union boss breaks down in tears at Queensland CFMEU inquiry

image.altText: An old woman and man, both wearing glasses, sit on chairs around a round wooden table

props.synopsis: The family of the late first wife of High Country killer Greg Lynn says a fresh investigation into her death has stalled because police will not pay for an expert report.

title.children: Fresh probe into Lisa Lynn's death stalls over $9,000 bill, family says

image.altText: dog and man on couch

props.synopsis: A man who allegedly misled police over the theft of his vehicle and family pet has been charged with driving offences and obstructing police.

title.children: Man who allegedly abandoned dog Arnie facing additional charges

image.altText: kevin wife homecare yard

props.synopsis: Care providers are trying to strongarm cash from suppliers of equipment, including wheelchairs, a month after the federal government reformed home care packages for senior Australians.

title.children: 'It's borderline illegal': The battle raging on the home care front

image.altText: Illustration of a person sitting below cards and dice that are rising above him

props.synopsis: Chat logs and gambling data show the tactics used by Australian-run online casino Stake to keep one user hooked.

title.children: One player's case against the world's biggest crypto casino

image.altText: Toddler in onesie.

props.synopsis: NSW police are urging anyone with information about toddler Jordan Thompson's 2005 death to come forward as they increase the reward on offer.

title.children: Police offer $500k reward for help solving mystery of toddler's fatal overdose
